org.pipservices.runtime

Class AbstractComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pipservices.runtime.AbstractComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractAddon, AbstractBootConfig, AbstractBusinessLogic, AbstractCache, AbstractClient, AbstractCounters, AbstractDiscovery, AbstractLogger, AbstractPersistence, AbstractService, NullCounters

    public abstract class AbstractComponent
extends Object
implements IComponent
    Abstract implementation for all microservice components.
    Since:
    2016-06-09
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sergey Seroukhov

    • Method Detail

      • getDescriptor

        public ComponentDescriptor getDescriptor()
        Gets the unique component descriptor that can identify and locate the component inside the microservice.
        Specified by:
        getDescriptor in interface IComponent
        Returns:
        the unique component descriptor.

        Gets the current state of the component.
        Specified by:
        getState in interface IComponent
        Returns:
        the current component state.

      • checkCurrentState

        protected void checkCurrentState(int state)
                          throws MicroserviceError
        Checks if specified state matches to the current one.
        Parameters:
        state - the expected state
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when current and expected states don't match

      • checkNewStateAllowed

        protected void checkNewStateAllowed(int newState)
                             throws MicroserviceError
        Checks if transition to the specified state is allowed from the current one.
        Parameters:
        newState - the new state to make transition
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when transition is not allowed.

      • configure

        public void configure(ComponentConfig config)
               throws MicroserviceError
        Sets component configuration parameters and switches from component to 'Configured' state. The configuration is only allowed once right after creation. Attempts to perform reconfiguration will cause an exception.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface IComponent
        Parameters:
        config - the component configuration parameters.
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when component is in illegal state or configuration validation fails.

      • link

        public void link(DynamicMap context,
                 ComponentSet components)
          throws MicroserviceError
        Sets references to other microservice components to enable their collaboration. It is recommended to locate necessary components and cache their references to void performance hit during normal operations. Linking can only be performed once after configuration and will cause an exception when it is called second time or out of order.
        Specified by:
        link in interface IComponent
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        components - references to microservice components.
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when requires components are not found.

      • open

        public void open()
          throws MicroserviceError
        Opens the component, performs initialization, opens connections to external services and makes the component ready for operations. Opening can be done multiple times: right after linking or reopening after closure.
        Specified by:
        open in interface IComponent
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when initialization or connections fail.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws MicroserviceError
        Closes the component and all open connections, performs deinitialization steps. Closure can only be done from opened state. Attempts to close already closed component or in wrong order will cause exception.
        Specified by:
        close in interface IComponent
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - with closure fails.

      • writeLog

        protected void writeLog(int level,
                        String correlationId,
                        Object[] message)
        Writes message to log
        Parameters:
        level - a message logging level
        correlationId - a unique id to identify distributed transaction
        message - a message objects

      • fatal

        public void fatal(String correlationId,
                  Object... message)
        Logs fatal error that causes microservice to shutdown
        Parameters:
        correlationId - a unique id to identify distributed transaction
        message - a list with message values

      • beginTiming

        public ITiming beginTiming(String name)
        Starts measurement of execution time interval. The method returns ITiming object that provides endTiming() method that shall be called when execution is completed to calculate elapsed time and update the counter.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of interval counter.
        Returns:
        callback interface with endTiming() method that shall be called at the end of execution.

      • stats

        public void stats(String name,
                  float value)
        Calculates rolling statistics: minimum, maximum, average and updates Statistics counter. This counter can be used to measure various non-functional characteristics, such as amount stored or transmitted data, customer feedback, etc.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of statistics counter.
        value - the value to add to statistics calculations.

      • last

        public void last(String name,
                 float value)
        Records the last reported value. This counter can be used to store performance values reported by clients or current numeric characteristics such as number of values stored in cache.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of last value counter
        value - the value to be stored as the last one

      • timestampNow

        public void timestampNow(String name)
        Records the current time. This counter can be used to track timing of key business transactions.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of timing counter

      • timestamp

        public void timestamp(String name,
                      ZonedDateTime value)
        Records specified time. This counter can be used to tack timing of key business transactions as reported by clients.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of timing counter.
        value - the reported timing to be recorded.

      • incrementOne

        public void incrementOne(String name)
        Increments counter by value of 1. This counter is often used to calculate number of client calls or performed transactions.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of counter counter.

      • increment

        public void increment(String name,
                      int value)
        Increments counter by specified value. This counter can be used to track various numeric characteristics
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the increment value.
        value - number to increase the counter.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Generates a string representation for this component
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a component descriptor in string format
